Debrief: Avail is a cloud-based property management platform designed for independent landlords and small rental businesses, offering tools for listing, tenant screening, lease management, online rent collection, and maintenance tracking. It is part of the Realtor.com network. The platform aims to simplify common landlord tasks and provide a user-friendly interface for managing rental properties. [1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 22]
HQ_Location: Originally founded in Chicago, IL. Corporate HQ post-acquisition by Realtor.com is in Santa Clara, California. Tracxn (2025-09-06) lists Chicago, United States, and Lexington, Kentucky as a registered address for the main Avail entity. A separate entity, 'Avail Property Management, Inc.', founded in 2021, is based in Denver, CO. [3, 10, 23]
CompanySize_Employees: 36 total employees (as of 2025, per PitchBook, as cited in previous research). Other estimates vary; a 2022 article mentioned 28-29 employees. Tracxn (2025-09-06) lists 5 employees for the main Avail entity as of Dec 2021, which is likely outdated. [3, 17, 18, 23]
CompanyStatus: Acquired by Realtor.com (Move, Inc.) in December 2020. [3, 23, 24]

CoreOffering_Summary: Avail provides an all-in-one, cloud-based property management solution for independent landlords, enabling them to manage rental properties from listing and tenant screening to lease signing, online rent collection, maintenance tracking, and financial accounting. [1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 22]
KeyFeatures_FinancialManagement: Online rent collection (bank transfers, credit/debit cards) [1, 2, 4, 9, 11, 12, 14]
Automated late fees and rent reminders [1, 4, 14]
Expense tracking and property accounting dashboard [1, 2, 4, 5, 11, 14, 20]
Credit Boost (rent payments reported to credit bureaus) [1, 14]
Next-day rent payments (FastPay) for Unlimited Plus users [1, 4, 12, 14, 22]
Waived ACH fees for Unlimited Plus users [1, 4, 12, 14]
KeyFeatures_OwnerCommunication: In-app messaging with tenants, leads, and applicants via the newly launched 'Avail Messages' feature (September 2025). [6, 26]
Customer service via phone and email [1, 4, 11]
Unlimited Plus offers priority customer support [1, 4, 14]
Website chat support is handled by a chatbot instead of a real person [1]
KeyFeatures_IncidentManagement: Maintenance tracking: Tenants can submit requests with photos, landlords can track status and add vendor contacts [1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 11, 14]
KeyFeatures_AI_Specific: An 'AI powered bot' is used for customer service. AI can also automatically request reference checks during tenant screening. [1] These are the only explicit AI mentions for property management, lacking predictive analytics for profitability. It is crucial to distinguish this Avail from other entities like 'AVAIL' (AEC industry), 'Avail Lease' (legal tech), or the 'Avail' Web3/blockchain project, or 'Avail | AI Platforms for Real Estate Lawyers' which utilize more advanced AI/ML for different purposes. [3, 25]
AI_Value_Proposition: Limited to customer support and automated reference checks, not focused on predictive analytics for profitability. [1]
Integration_Capabilities: Integrates with major listing sites (e.g., Zillow, Realtor.com, Trulia, Zumper, Hotpads, Apartments.com, Apartment List, Redfin, Padmapper, Walkscore, Doorsteps.com, Rentable). Uses TransUnion for tenant screening. [2, 4, 8, 11, 14]
Mobile_App_Presence: No dedicated mobile app; mobile-friendly web interface available. Recent 2025 reviews consistently highlight the lack of a dedicated app as a weakness, with no indication of a released app despite previous mentions of planned development. Avail states that development of an app is 'planned for the future'. [1, 7]
TargetAudience_Primary: Independent landlords and small rental businesses (DIY landlords) managing anywhere from one to 10 properties, with some sources mentioning up to 50 units. [1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 11, 16, 22]
MarketSegment_Focus: Small-scale or independent landlords, not large property management firms. [1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 11, 16, 22]
ValueProposition_USP: An all-in-one platform that simplifies property management for DIY landlords, offering a comprehensive free plan and user-friendly tools for listing, screening, leasing, and rent collection. [1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 11, 16, 22]
Positioning_Statement: Avail positions itself as an end-to-end platform to help landlords scale from beginner to professional with tools, support, and education. [8, 16, 24]
BusinessModel: Freemium model, offering a free plan with core features and a paid 'Unlimited Plus' plan for advanced functionalities. Revenue is generated through subscriptions, transaction fees, and tenant screening report fees. [1, 2, 4, 9, 12, 14, 15]
PricingModel_Basis: Per unit per month for the paid plan, or free for unlimited units with basic features. [1, 2, 4, 9, 12, 14, 15]
Pricing_Tiers_Summary: 1. **Unlimited (Free)**: Includes unlimited units, syndicated listings, background screening, state-specific leases, online rent collection, maintenance tracking, property accounting, and online tenant portal. Tenants pay $2.50 per bank transfer. [1, 4, 9, 12, 14] 2. **Unlimited Plus (Paid)**: Costs $9/unit/month. Includes all Unlimited features plus next-day rent payments (FastPay), waived ACH fees, custom applications and leases, property websites, and priority customer support. [1, 4, 12, 14, 19]
Pricing_EntryLevel_EUR: Free plan: $0 USD. Paid plan: $9 USD/unit/month.
FreeTrial_Offered: Yes, the 'Unlimited' plan serves as a comprehensive free offering. [1, 4, 9, 14]
CustomerBase_Size_Estimate: Over 100,000 active landlords (as of November 2024). A 2022 article mentioned 'More than 600,000 landlords and renters use Avail'. [17, 20]
Funding_Total_EUR: Approximately $9.67 million USD (prior to acquisition by Realtor.com). [3]
Key_Investors: Cultivation Capital, MetaProp NYC (prior to acquisition). [3]
Recent_News_KeyDevelopments: Acquired by Realtor.com (Move, Inc.) in December 2020. [3, 23, 24]

Continued focus on enhancing features for DIY landlords, including new tools like Promoted Listings, Property Tour Automation, Direct Applications, and Renters Insurance Options. [1, 2, 4, 8, 11, 16, 22]

The lack of a dedicated mobile app remains a consistent point of feedback in 2025 reviews, with no indication of a released app despite previous mentions of planned development. Avail states that development of an app is 'planned for the future'. [1, 7]
Avail is an official sponsor and will be attending BPCON 2025 (October 5-7, 2025) in Las Vegas at Caesars Palace. [26]
Matt Eatherton, Head of Avail, will participate in BPCON 2025. [20]

BPCON 2025 showcase will also include new tools, expert insights, and exclusive ways for landlords to connect, including lease automation tools, enhanced maintenance tracking, faster rent collection workflows, and rental property accounting upgrades. [26]
Newly launched 'Avail Messages' feature (September 2025) provides centralized in-app communication for tenants, leads, and applicants. [6, 26]
Reported_Strengths: Comprehensive features for DIY landlords (all-in-one solution). [1, 2, 4, 8, 11, 16, 22]
Online rent collection is a standout feature. [1, 2, 4, 9, 11, 12, 14, 22]
Good customer support (though chat is chatbot). [1, 4, 11]
Reported_Weaknesses: Premium features are locked behind the paid plan. [1, 4, 9, 14, 15, 22]
Fees for background checks vary and can be an extra cost. [1, 4, 11, 14]
May not be robust enough for landlords with extensive portfolios or large property management firms. [1, 4, 8, 9, 22]
Website chat support is handled by a chatbot instead of a real person. [1]
Pricing for more extensive portfolios can become expensive compared to competitors. [15]
Navigation can be tricky for tenants setting up accounts. [4]
Marketing_Channels_Primary: Review sites (The Close, ToolsForHumans.ai, YouTube, Tracxn, OMR Reviews, Tekpon, Software Finder, G2, Real Estate Bees) [1, 4, 8, 9, 15, 22]
Sales_Approach: Primarily self-service/online sign-up, with customer support available for assistance. [1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 11, 16, 22]
Geographic_Presence: Primarily United States, offering state-specific leases and catering to US landlords. [1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 11, 16, 22]
ReviewSites_Presence: Yes (G2, Trustpilot, Google Reviews, The Close, ToolsForHumans.ai, YouTube, Tracxn, OMR Reviews, Tekpon, Software Finder, Real Estate Bees). [1, 4, 8, 9, 15, 22]
Average_Rating_Overall: Generally positive, with specific ratings varying by platform. Reviews highlight ease of use and comprehensive features for small landlords. [1, 4, 8, 9, 11, 22]
Total_Reviews_Count: N/A (No single aggregate number found across platforms).
Review_CommonThemes_Positive: Easy to use and user-friendly interface. [1, 2, 4, 8, 11, 22]
Review_CommonThemes_Negative: Premium features require a paid subscription. [1, 4, 9, 14, 15, 22]
Additional fees for tenant screening reports. [1, 4, 11, 14]
Not robust enough for larger portfolios or property management firms. [1, 4, 8, 9, 22]
Website chat support is handled by a chatbot instead of a real person. [1]
Pricing for more extensive portfolios can become expensive compared to competitors. [15]
Navigation can be tricky for tenants setting up accounts. [4]
Review_CommonThemes_AI_Opinions: Reviews mention the use of an AI-powered bot for customer service and AI assisting with automated reference checks during tenant screening. [1]
Automation_Depth: Avail offers basic to moderate rule-based automation, primarily for reactive tasks such as rent reminders, late fees, listing syndication, and maintenance request management. It also uses AI for automated reference checks and has an AI-powered chatbot for customer service. The newly launched 'Avail Messages' feature centralizes communication for tenants, leads, and applicants. Upcoming features to be showcased at BPCON 2025 include lease automation tools, enhanced maintenance tracking, faster rent collection workflows, and rental property accounting upgrades. It lacks deep, proactive AI-driven automation for profitability optimization or predictive analytics. [1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 11, 12, 14, 15, 26]
Focus_On_Business_Owner_ROI: Avail's messaging focuses on simplifying property management for individual landlords and improving operational efficiency and basic financial tracking for their own properties. While it mentions 'optimizing for long-term growth' and 'maximizing your profit' [5, 16, 20], the emphasis is on the individual landlord's operational ease rather than granular, predictive profitability optimization for a property management firm owner with multiple communities. [1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11, 16, 20, 22]
Innovadmin_Differentiation_Points: **Proactive AI for profitability optimization**: Innovadmin's 'Profit-Focused AI' with predictive analytics (payment defaults, budget optimization) is a core differentiator. While Avail uses AI for customer service and reference checks, it lacks explicit AI features for property management profitability.

**Focus on scaling client portfolios**: Innovadmin targets property management firms seeking to scale client portfolios without linearly increasing staff, whereas Avail is designed for individual landlords managing their own properties.

**Direct ROI metrics and business intelligence for owners**: Innovadmin provides owner-centric dashboards for strategic decision-making and measurable ROI. Avail offers basic accounting and rent analysis, but not the deep business intelligence for management firm owners.

**Specialized solutions for property management firms**: Innovadmin targets mid-to-large property management firms (50-500 communities), a distinct market from Avail's focus on independent landlords (1-50 units).
Threat_Level_To_Innovadmin: Low. Avail's primary target audience (independent landlords managing 1-50 units) is fundamentally different from Innovadmin's Ideal Customer Profile (property management firms managing 50-500 communities). Avail does not offer the AI-powered profitability optimization that is Innovadmin's core value proposition.
Opportunity_For_Innovadmin: **Target Market Gap**: Avail's clear focus on individual landlords leaves a significant market gap for Innovadmin to target larger property management firms that require sophisticated, AI-driven solutions for profitability and scalability.

**AI & Predictive Analytics**: Avail's absence of AI-powered predictive analytics for profitability creates an opportunity for Innovadmin to highlight its 'Profit-Focused AI' as a key differentiator for management firm owners.

**Business Intelligence**: Innovadmin can emphasize its owner-centric dashboards and strategic decision-making tools, which provide a deeper level of business intelligence than the operational and basic financial tracking offered by Avail.
Notes_QualitativeInsights: It is critical to distinguish between 'Avail' the property management software (acquired by Realtor.com) and other unrelated entities like 'Avail' the Web3/blockchain project, 'Avail Lease' for legal tech, or 'Avail | AI Platforms for Real Estate Lawyers' for the AEC industry. [3, 25] The property management Avail was originally founded in Chicago. Its corporate HQ moved to Santa Clara, California, post-acquisition by Realtor.com, but Tracxn (2025-09-06) also lists Chicago, United States, and Lexington, Kentucky as a registered address for the main Avail entity. A separate entity, 'Avail Property Management, Inc.', founded in 2021, is based in Denver, CO. [3, 10, 23] Recent 2025 reviews consistently highlight the lack of a dedicated mobile app as a weakness, with no indication of a released app despite previous mentions of planned development; Avail states that development of an app is 'planned for the future'. [1, 7] The official pricing for the Unlimited Plus plan is consistently reported as $9/unit/month in recent 2025 reviews. [1, 4, 12, 19] Avail is an official sponsor of BPCON 2025 (October 5-7, 2025, Caesars Palace, Las Vegas), where it plans to showcase new tools, expert insights, and exclusive ways for landlords to connect, including lease automation tools, enhanced maintenance tracking, faster rent collection workflows, rental property accounting upgrades. [26] A significant new development is the launch of 'Avail Messages' in September 2025, providing centralized in-app communication for tenants, leads, and applicants. [6, 26] Its active customer base is estimated at over 100,000 landlords as of November 2024, while an older 2022 article mentioned over 600,000 landlords and renters using the platform. [17, 20] Conflicting employee count estimates exist, with PitchBook reporting 36 employees for 2025 (as per previous research), while Tracxn shows 5 employees for the main Avail entity as of Dec 2021, and a 2022 funding article mentioned 28 employees. [3, 17, 18, 23]
